Dear Rich

At the risk of climbing onto my personal hobby horse, I cannot =

accept the suggestion that the illustrated tsuba is Namban.  Even 
accepti=
ng the redundant definition of Namban tsuba as being 'work 
exhibiting fore=
ign influences',I am unable to reconise any foreign - 
even Chinese - influ=
ences on this guard.  Even were such influences 
be present, it would surel=
y qualify as Hizen rather than as Namban 
work? 

My impression, although I=
 would hate to have to present a reasoned 
argument for it, is rather of Mi=
ochin work.  Is this an acceptable 
label?

Regards, John L.
